CoC7.title: Call of Cthulhu 7th Edition
CoC7.help:
ã€ğŸ¦‘Cthulhu Mythos RPG Systemã€‘
â•­â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ ğŸ²Basic Rolls â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
â”‚ COC6th: ccb 80  (skill â‰¤ 80)
â”‚ COC7th: cc 80   (skill â‰¤ 80)
â”‚ 
â”‚ ğŸ¯Bonus Dice: cc(1~2) 
â”‚ Example: cc1 80 one bonus die
â”‚ 
â”‚ âš ï¸Penalty Dice: ccn(1~2) 
â”‚ Example: ccn2 80 two penalty dice
â”‚
â”‚ ğŸ“ŠCombined Checks:
â”‚ ã€€cc 80,40 Spot Hidden,Fighting
â”‚ ã€€cc1 80,40 Spot Hidden,Fighting (bonus die)
â”‚ ã€€ccn1 80,40 Spot Hidden,Fighting (penalty die)
â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ ğŸ’€Sanity Check â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
â”‚ Format: .sc (SAN value) (success)/(failure)
â”‚ Examples:
â”‚ ã€€.sc 50
â”‚ ã€€.sc 50 1/1d3+1
â”‚ ã€€.sc 50 1d10/1d100
â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ ğŸƒChase and Insanity â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
â”‚ .chase    - Chase Generator
â”‚ ã€€â€»Using optional rules and my interpretation of the rulebook,
â”‚ ã€€â€»Please read Chapter 7 "Chase" in the CoC7Th rulebook before use
â”‚ 
â”‚ ccrt     - Immediate Insanity Check
â”‚ ccsu     - Summary Insanity Check
â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ ğŸ“šMythos Related â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
â”‚ .cccc    - Random Mythos Organization
â”‚ .ccdr    - Random Mythos Data
â”‚ .ccpc    - Pushed Casting Consequence
â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ ğŸ‘¤Character Creation â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
â”‚ .ccpulpbuild      - PULP Character Creation
â”‚ .cc6build         - COC6th Character Creation
â”‚ .cc7build        - COC7th Character Creation (ages 7-89)
â”‚ .cc7build random - COC7th Random Character Creation
â”‚ 
â”‚ Free Point Distribution:
â”‚ .cc7build .xyz   - Custom dice method
â”‚ Example: .cc7build .752
â”‚ ã€€7 times: 3d6Ã—5
â”‚ ã€€5 times: (2d6+6)Ã—5
â”‚ ã€€2 times: 3d6Ã—5
â”‚ Can just input . Default is .53
â”‚ ã€€i.e., 5 times 3d6Ã—5 and 3 times (2d6+6)Ã—5
â”œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ ğŸ“ˆDevelopment Related â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
â”‚ Development Check: 
â”‚ .dp (skill%) (name)
â”‚ Example: .dp 50 Ride 80 Fighting 70 60
â”‚ 
â”‚ .cc7bg - Random Character Background
â”‚
â”‚ ğŸ“.dp Development Record Function:
â”‚ Records skills that succeed and critical/fumble in CC rolls
â”‚ .dp start   - Start recording rolls
â”‚ .dp stop    - Stop recording rolls
â”‚ .dp show    - Show your roll records
â”‚ .dp showall - Show all channel roll records
â”‚ .dp auto    - Auto development and clear records
â”‚ .dp clear   - Clear your roll records
â”‚ .dp clearall- Clear all critical/fumble records

CoC7.rt.0:
Loses consciousness, lies flat on the ground, muttering incoherently, like an epileptic seizure.
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
CoC7.rt.1:
Falls into extreme fear, screaming, fleeing, trying to hide.
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
CoC7.rt.2:
Paralyzed, standing still or collapsed on the ground, whole body trembling.
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
CoC7.rt.3:
Frantically performs actions described in books.
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
CoC7.rt.4:
Experiences altered memories, can be explained in a separate scene.
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
CoC7.rt.5:
Loud shouting (crying, screaming, laughing).
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
CoC7.rt.6:
Becomes violent, attacks others.
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
CoC7.rt.7:
Experiences hallucinations, can be judged by others if objects are replaced.
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
CoC7.rt.8:
Mania: Temporary psychotic episode.
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
Temporary mania, such as: non-stop talking, hypersexuality, foul language, or compulsive shopping.
CoC7.rt.9:
Panic Disorder: Temporary psychotic episode.
Symptoms last 1d10 rounds.
Can be any phobia, such as: acrophobia, claustrophobia, or arachnophobia.
CoC7.su.0:
Amnesia: The investigator will find they only remember the last safe place they were, with no memory of how they got here.
Symptoms last 1d10 hours.
CoC7.su.1:
Pseudodisability: The investigator falls into psychological blindness, deafness, or muteness. While appearing to have lost these senses, it's actually psychological and usually recovers at irregular intervals.
Symptoms last 1d10 hours.
CoC7.su.2:
Violent Tendencies: The investigator falls into violent behavior, attacking both enemies and allies indiscriminately.
Symptoms last 1d10 hours.
CoC7.su.3:
Paranoia: The investigator falls into a paranoid state, firmly believing they are being persecuted by a small conspiracy.
Symptoms last 1d10 hours.
CoC7.su.4:
Dependency: The investigator, for some reason, becomes a slave to others' will, basically agreeing to any request.
Symptoms last 1d10 hours.
CoC7.su.5:
Fainting: The investigator faints on the spot and needs 1d10 rounds to wake up, feeling weak after waking.
Symptoms last 1d10 hours.
CoC7.su.6:
Escape Behavior: The investigator strongly feels the need to leave, may go through their room to collect items, or even try to escape through windows.
Symptoms last 1d10 hours.
CoC7.su.7:
Hysteria: The investigator shows extreme emotional expressions like laughing, crying, screaming, fear, etc. Fear will last 1d10 hours.
Symptoms last 1d10 hours.
CoC7.su.8:
Mania: The investigator falls into temporary mental confusion, may show strange thoughts or behaviors. This symptom will last 1d10 hours.
Temporary mania, such as: non-stop talking, hypersexuality, foul language, or compulsive shopping.
CoC7.su.9:
Fear: The investigator falls into temporary mental confusion, may show strange thoughts or behaviors. This symptom will last 1d10 hours.
Can be any phobia, such as: acrophobia, claustrophobia, or arachnophobia.
CoC7.chase.title: CoC 7th Edition Chase Generator
CoC7.chase.danger:
Failure loses {{damage}} HP damage
and loses (1D3) action points
CoC7.character.pulp.title: Pulp CoC No Age Adjustment
CoC7.character.6th.title: 6th Edition Core Character Creation:
CoC7.character.6th.note:
Investigator's minimum starting age equals EDU+6. For each decade older than starting age,
the investigator gains one point of EDU and 20 occupational skill points.
After age 40, for each decade older,
reduce one point from STR, CON, DEX, or APP.
CoC7.pcbg.title: Background Description Generator (For entertainment only, not for actual reference)
CoC7.pcbg.description:
The investigator is a {{appearance}} person.
ã€Beliefã€‘: Speaking of this person, they {{belief}}.
ã€Significant Personã€‘: The most important person to them is {{significantPerson}}, who is important because {{significantPersonWhy}}.
ã€Meaningful Locationã€‘: The most important place to them is {{meaningfulLocation}}.
ã€Treasured Possessionã€‘: Their most precious possession is {{treasuredPossession}}.
ã€Traitã€‘: Overall, the investigator is {{trait}}.
CoC7.mythos.title: Cthulhu Mythos Data
CoC7.pushedCasting.powerful:
For more powerful spells (such as summoning deities or POW-consuming spells), side effects may be more severe:
{{effect}}

=======COC7th Random Character Creation=======
Investigator age set to: {{age}}

(Please manually choose calculation).
EDU reduced by 5 points. LUK roll twice take higher.
=======
(For the following two items with arrows, subtract {{debuff}} points.)
CoC7.builder7.random.ageAdjustment.20-39:
Age Adjustment: Can make {{eduInc}} EDU development rolls.
=======
CoC7.builder7.random.ageAdjustment.40-49:
Age Adjustment: Subtract {{debuff}} points from STR, DEX, or CON
(Please manually choose calculation).
APP reduced by {{appDebuff}} points. Make {{eduInc}} EDU development rolls.
=======
(For the following three items with arrows, choose to subtract {{debuff}} points.)
CoC7.builder7.random.ageAdjustment.50+:
Age Adjustment: Subtract {{debuff}} points from STR, DEX, or CON
(Choose from one, two, or all three)
(Please manually choose calculation).
APP reduced by {{appDebuff}} points. Make {{eduInc}} EDU development rolls.
=======
(For the following three items with arrows, choose to subtract {{debuff}} points.)
CoC7.cult.title: Random Mythos Organization Generator
CoC7.cult.stats.name: Name: {{name}}
CoC7.cult.leader.1:
Wealthy Merchant
Money is power. Owner of a successful small business; member of a multinational corporation's board; powerful film producer; investment banker, etc.
CoC7.cult.leader.2:
Family Matriarch/Patriarch
Blood is a special and binding connection. Ancient grandmother of a large family in the Appalachians; distinguished great-grandfather of a large and aristocratic family; descendant of a powerful wizard; single parent of twins.
CoC7.cult.leader.3:
Gang Leader
Criminals have a way of operating under the radarâ€”this experience might help in hiding Cthulhu cult activities. Leader of an urban street gang; boss of a criminal organization; leader of a large drug cartel; up-and-coming street thug admired by other kids.
CoC7.cult.leader.4:
Religious Leader
Already in a position of influence, can reach large numbers of people, some desperately in need of help, more susceptible to fraud and temptation.
These religious leaders may be tax-exempt. Priests, rabbis, imams, or pastors of mainstream religions.
CoC7.cult.leader.6:
Politician
Political influence can guide policy, even change laws. Mayor or city council member; state legislature member; governor or even national president.
CoC7.cult.leader.7:
Farmer/Factory Worker
"Blue-collar" religious sect leaders may have influence over those who keep society running smoothly, such as factory workers, rural workers, construction industry, and maintenance workers.
CoC7.cult.leader.8:
Military Officer
Having a cult in the military is a terrifying thought. Could be a higher-ranking officer in the troops, or an operative in intelligence agencies like the FBI or CIA, or similar agencies in other countries.
CoC7.cult.leader.9:
Ship Captain
At sea, the captain is in a very powerful position. Could be the captain of a large transport ship, a sailing ship, a merchant ship, or even a cruise ship.
CoC7.cult.leader.10:
Outsider
These individuals operate on the fringes of society, often overlooked, such as traveling salesmen, web developers working from home, or a blues guitarist/singer.
CoC7.cult.power.1:
Mythos Creature
The cult has one or more powerful mythos creatures as allies. For example: a hunter in the wind, a black goat of the woods, multiple shoggoths, several ghouls, a shoggoth, a member of the servant race, or a mi-go.
CoC7.cult.power.2:
Mythos Outer God or Great Old One
The cult serves a powerful deity, such as: Nyarlathotep, Cthulhu, Shub-Niggurath, or Yog-Sothoth.
CoC7.cult.power.3:
Unknown Energy Source
The cult's energy source is unknown, perhaps cosmic waves, or an indescribable great artifact.
CoC7.cult.power.4:
Ancient Magic
The cult uses ancient magic, such as: shoggoth transformation, longevity spells, life extension spells, or other insidious spells.
CoC7.cult.wants.1:
Wealth
The cult desires all possible forms of wealth, but mainly hard assets that remain unafraid of market crashes and inflation.
CoC7.cult.wants.2:
Reproduction
Spread the cult's special bloodline, in human form or other more hybrid ways.
CoC7.cult.wants.3:
Restoration
To rebuild past greatness or restore former gloryâ€”bringing an old god or ancient strange being back to Earth.
CoC7.cult.wants.4:
Destruction
The cult wants to annihilate its enemies. This could be another cult, a group, a country, or the entire world.
CoC7.cult.wants.5:
Desire
The cult leader has strong desires for cult membersâ€”could be romantic or sexual, or other ways to satisfy the leader's physical or sexual needs.
CoC7.cult.wants.6:
Collection
The worshippers may be seeking some unique item. This could be an ancient artifact, special crystal, or modern item, preferably not too obvious.
CoC7.cult.wants.7:
Life
The cult leader or sub-leader appears to be a resurrected being (such as zombies, vampires, mummies, ghouls, etc.) and needs to regularly consume human flesh or living souls to maintain their vitality.
CoC7.cult.wants.8:
Political Power
The cult organization strives to gain power at local, regional, or national levels.
CoC7.cult.wants.9:
Sacrifice
The cult often desires people to dedicate their time, money, or parts of their bodies, such as kidneys, hearts, brains, or entire bodies.
CoC7.cult.wants.10:
Magical Power
The cult is seeking magical texts, spells, spiritual mediums, magical items, knowledge about mythos deities, or the use of magical totems.
CoC7.cult.means.1:
Conspiracy to Assassinate
Planned murder is an intentional branch of assassin murder. Such plans usually target power holders, leaders, or those considered dangerous to the cult.
CoC7.cult.means.2:
Secret Business Activities
One of the best ways to obtain funds or personnel is through business activities, such as: establishing MLM organizations; inducing members to donate to the organization; obtaining funds through membership fees; operating under the guise of fake charity; running illegal transactions like collectibles, drugs, or sex trade.
CoC7.cult.means.3:
Kidnapping or Murder
Some cults believe they must kidnap victims to perform rituals or as offerings. Others hope to sacrifice humanity through "natural" murder or cases that appear to be suicide.
CoC7.cult.means.4:
Material Bribery
One of the simplest ways to brainwash certain people is to bribe or provide what they desire. For some, this might be money; for others, it could be sex, family, or even food and shelter, as these are basic needs. Money can buy many things, and some people can be bought with enough money.
CoC7.cult.means.5:
Mind Control
Means like magic or psychological tactics, such as: hypnosis, black magic, deception, psychic powers, mythos magic, or complete body possession, are convenient ways to control or force others to meet cult needs.
CoC7.cult.means.6:
Information Dissemination
Control the media to attract more people and spread distorted information. For example through flyers, newspapers, radio programs, or arranging special programs for believers. Spread works in local gatherings or underground meetings, possibly called spiritual medium fellowship, etc.
CoC7.cult.means.7:
Terrorism
Force people to comply through intimidation. Such as: strategies to burn down opponents' houses; pressure on families of those forced to join the cult; exile of the disobedient or making them suffer; breaking into enemy rooms to leave terrifying warnings; or even direct threats to life.
CoC7.cult.means.8:
Soul Trading
Non-believers' souls provide special and powerful magical elements. The cult may use a spell to permanently bind or even consume souls. Those who choose to donate their souls may receive long life, power, or wealth in exchange.
CoC7.cult.means.9:
Invitation to Alliance
One of the simplest ways to make others compliant is to make them feel valued. Alliance might be through invitation, forging a letter from a lofty person or authority figure, or official documents from the government. Invited people might be told this is an extremely honorable religious organization that will provide power, wealth, health, or even the opportunity to resurrect the dead.
CoC7.cult.means.10:
Mythos Magic
With the help of ancient spells, the cult may use various mythos magic to achieve its goals. The "Necronomicon" and other texts are ideal sources of information. Spells might include: flesh melting, curses, summoning and binding mythos creatures, or shaking the world for greater goals.

CoC7.dp.channelNotEnabled: CC recording function not enabled in this channel, please use .dp start to enable
CoC7.dp.switchStatus:
COC development recording function in this channel is now {{status}}
CC rolls will {{willRecord}} be recorded
CoC7.dp.growthSuccess: 1D100 > {{target}} Rolled: {{skill}}  â†’  "{{name}}" development successful! Skill increased by {{improved}} points, now {{newTarget}} points. - {{date}}
CoC7.dp.sanityIncrease: When the investigator's skill increases above 90%, their current sanity increases by {{sanIncrease}} points.
CoC7.dp.recordsCleared: Cleared {{count}} records, if you want to clear critical success and fumble records too, please use .dp clearall
CoC7.dp.allRecordsCleared: Cleared all your CC roll records in this channel, total {{count}} items
CoC7.dp.channelRecords: No records in this channel, please roll more dice!
CoC7.slash.build.cc7build.age.descriptio: Optional: (age 7-89) If not provided, will use random character creation
CoC7.slash.dpg.mode.showall: Show all critical success and fumble roll records in channel
CoC7.slash.dpg.mode.auto: Perform automatic development and clear roll records
CoC7.slash.dpg.mode.clearall: Clear roll records including critical success and fumble
